title: No compromise on country’s stability: lawyer - Pakistan - DAWN.COM
content:
QUETTA: The president of the Balochistan High Court Bar Association, Mir Attaullah Langove, has said that the lawyer’s body stood shoulder to shoulder with the government and the armed forces against Indian aggression.

He said that after the Pahalgam incident, the Modi government levelled shameful allegations against Pakistan without any evidence.

Talking to the media here, Mr Langove said that lawyers had given a clear message to India that no compromise would be accepted on the survival, security and stability of Pakistan.

Mr Langove said Pakistan is a nuclear country and wanted peace in the region, but if India imposed a war, “defeat would be its destiny”.

He called for the timely holding of a meeting of the National Security Committee and also paid tribute to Prime Minister Shehbaz Sharif and Army Chief Gen Asim Munir for formulating a comprehensive action plan.

Published in Dawn, May 5th, 2025
